newsitem.title: KENYA: Attackers kill 16 in northwest Rwanda.
newsitem.headline: Attackers kill 16 in northwest Rwanda.

text.p: At least 16 people were killed in northwest Rwanda by a group suspected of being former Rwandan soldiers and militant ethnic Hutu Interahamwe militia, the Rwanda News Agency reported.
The agency quoted sources in Ruhengeri Prefecture as saying the group attacked the home of the headmaster of a local secondary school on Thursday night, killing him, his wife and his three children.

"Eleven other people were also killed by the militiamen, and one vehicle burned," a human rights group in the capital Kigali told the agency on Friday. The comments were monitored by the British Broadcasting Corporation in Kenya's capital Nairobi.
"An unknown number of criminals were reportedly killed in the ensuing clashes with the army," the group added.

Former Rwandan government troops and Interahamwe are largely blamed for the slaughter of nearly 800,000 minority ethnic Tutsi in 1994. Kigali says they attack civilian targets to destabilise the government.
